articles.title: Appeal for Commemorating Day of Sun Hailed
Floral Basket Laid before Statue of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Appeal for Commemorating Day of Sun Hailed 
   Cairo, June 2 (KCNA) -- Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, secretary general of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, released a statement on May 29 in support of the appeal the Swiss Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 made to commemorate the Day of the Sun and Feb. 16 in 2007 as the common holidays of the world progressive humankind.
 Hs said in the statement that the association fully supports the appeal to organize colorful functions on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and February holiday next year and visit the native home in the secret camp of Mt. Paektu where leader           Kim Jong Il was born in February.    
 He underscored the need to organize the Egyptian preparatory committee, calling on different organizations of Egypt to grandiosely commemorate the significant holidays.

Floral Basket Laid before Statue of Kim Il Sung 
   Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates to the Fifth Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair placed a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill Sunday.
 They laid the basket of flowers before his statue and made a bow with boundless reverence for the President who devoted all his life to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of the people and made immortal contributions to the accomplishment of the human cause of independence and the development of friendly relations among countries.

articles.content:
57th Rally for Peace and Disarmament Held in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and other civic and social organizations in south Korea reportedly held the 57th rally for peace and disarmament in front of the building of the Defence Ministry on May 30 to denounce the moves of the military authorities to increase the "budget for national defence".
 Speakers said that it is an act of deceiving the people for the Defence Ministry to drastically increase the defence budget for 2007 under the pretext of allegedly increasing the military capability according to the plan for cooperative and independent national defence. In case the ministry purchases ultra-modern weapons with the increased budget, this will deepen south Korea's military subordination to the U.S., they said.    
 A written protest to the ministry was read out at the rally, which asserted that the ministry and the Planning and Budgetary Agency should stop the closed-door debate on defence budget.

Pakistani President Supports Peaceful Solution of Issue of Korea's Reunification
   Pyongyang, June 3 (KCNA) -- Pakistani President Pervez Musharraf expressed hope that the issue of Korea's reunification would be solved peacefully as desired by the Korean people. He said this when receiving credentials from the DPRK ambassador e.p. to Pakistan on May 30.
 Noting that the friendly relations between the two countries are long-standing and very good, he wished the friendly Korean people great success in their work for the development and prosperity of the country.

North Side Delegation Leaves for South 
   Pyongyang, June 3 (KCNA) -- The north side delegation led by Ju Tong Chan, vice-chairman of the National Economic Cooperation Committee who is chairman of the north side to the North-South Committee for Promotion of Economic Cooperation, left here Saturday to participate in the 12th meeting of the committee to be held on Jeju Island.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kwon Ho Ung, chief councilor of the Cabinet who is head of the north side to the inter-Korean ministerial talks, Kim Song Il, vice-chairman of the National Economic Cooperation Committee, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Greetings to General Secretary of Lao People's Revolutionary Party
Kim Jong Il Appreciates Art Performance
articles.content:
Greetings to General Secretary of Lao People's Revolutionary Party
   Pyongyang, June 3 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a congratulatory message to Choummaly Saynasone, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, Saturday on the occasion of his 70th birthday.
 The message expressed the belief that the traditional ties of friendship and cooperation between the two parties would continue to consolidate and develop in the interests of the two peoples and wished the general secretary good health and happiness as well as success in his responsible work for the strengthening of the party and the prosperity of the country.
